description.narrative: Stage II of the Australia-Pacific Technical College will work in partnership with industry and regional governments to produce ‘work-ready’ Pacific islands graduates to Australian standards. It will bolster economic growth in the Pacific by helping to develop a more competitive regional workforce and, in some cases, will assist mobility of skilled workers between the Pacific and developed countries. Options for longer-term arrangements beyond 2015 will be considered alongside the start up of Stage 2. The college will not seek to replace, but will complement existing training in the region. Particular attention will however be paid to access by students from throughout the region, including the smaller island states. One significant element of this will be scholarship program to be funded out of the overall cost. The total cost of this initiative is $0.4 million over 3 years, starting 2009-10.
